name: Cisco Meraki
summary: Takes in raw Cisco Meraki Logs and extracts the fields. Uses port 1514
description: Receives Cisco Meraki syslogs and extracts the various fields then converts them in a separate stream to the appropriate field type and then sends them back to the original stream to keep the stream pipelines clean. The "Meraki - UNIX Epoch Conversion with Timezone" will need to be edited. Change "America/Los_Angeles" to the appropriate timezone for your location. View the GitHub instructions.md file for more information like adding the lookup tables, etc.

description.@value: Converts specified Field to correct type.
Converts the protocol number to its IANA IP description and removes duplicate field.
Converts specified Field to correct type.
Lookup table for wireless band
Converts snort priority to description.
Triggers an alert when a martian_vlan event is detected from a device.
Checks if src_ip is internal, sets field if so.

source.@value:
rule "Meraki - check_src_ip"
when
    cidr_match("192.168.0.0/16", to_ip($message.meraki_src_ip)) ||
    cidr_match("172.16.0.0/12", to_ip($message.meraki_src_ip)) ||
    cidr_match("10.0.0.0/8", to_ip($message.meraki_src_ip))
then
    set_field("meraki_src_internal_ip",true);
end

source.@value:
pipeline "Cisco Meraki"
stage 0 match either
rule "Meraki - Extract Syslog PRI"
rule "Meraki - Airmarshal Events"
rule "Meraki - Events"
rule "Meraki - Firewall"
rule "Meraki - Flows"
rule "Meraki - IP Flow"
rule "Meraki - URLS"
rule "Meraki - Events - Content Filtering"
rule "Meraki - Events - DHCP No Offers"
rule "Meraki - Events - FIPS Event"
rule "Meraki - Events - Port Status Change"
rule "Meraki - Events - Route Connection Change"
rule "Meraki - Events - STP Role Change"
rule "Meraki - Events - Two MACs Same IP"
rule "Meraki - Events - APS Association"
rule "Meraki - MAC Flap Detected"
rule "Meraki - IDS Alerts"
rule "Meraki - Security Event"
rule "Meraki - Events - Blocked DHCP Server"
stage 1 match either
rule "Meraki - arp_src"
rule "Meraki - band"
rule "Meraki - dhcp_ip"
rule "Meraki - dhcp_server"
rule "Meraki - dns_server"
rule "Meraki - dst_ip"
rule "Meraki - epoch"
rule "Meraki - ip_src"
rule "Meraki - is_wpa"
rule "Meraki - last_known_client_ip"
rule "Meraki - radio"
rule "Meraki - src_ip"
rule "Meraki - translated_src_ip"
rule "Meraki - UNIX Epoch Conversion with Timezone"
rule "Meraki - last_known_client_ip6"
rule "Meraki - client_ip"
rule "Meraki - server"
rule "Meraki - reason"
rule "Meraki - best_ap"
rule "Meraki - original_server_ip"
rule "Meraki - server_ip"
rule "Meraki - peer"
rule "Meraki - icmp_type"
rule "Meraki - icmp6_type"
rule "Meraki - priority"
rule "Meraki - UNIX Event Timestamp Conversion with Timezone"
stage 2 match either
rule "Meraki - urls_url_ip6"
rule "Meraki - protocol"
rule "Meraki - frame_control"
rule "Meraki - rssi_signal_strength "
rule "Meraki - best_ap_rssi_signal_strength "
rule "Meraki - check_dst_ip"
rule "Meraki - check_src_ip"
stage 3 match either
rule "Meraki - dst_ip_check"
rule "Meraki - src_ip_check"
end

source.@value:
rule "Meraki - check_dst_ip"
when
    cidr_match("192.168.0.0/16", to_ip($message.meraki_dst_ip)) ||
    cidr_match("172.16.0.0/12", to_ip($message.meraki_dst_ip)) ||
    cidr_match("10.0.0.0/8", to_ip($message.meraki_dst_ip))
then
    set_field("meraki_dst_internal_ip",true);
end

source.@value:
rule "Meraki - threat_indicated"
when
  to_bool($message.meraki_dst_ip_spamhaus_threat_indicated) || to_bool($message.meraki_src_ip_spamhaus_threat_indicated)
then
  set_field("meraki_threat_indicated", true);
end
